programme.title: Earth: The Nature of Our Planet
programme.desc: How the flow of water has the power to shape all inhabitants on Earth, produces climate-changing weather and supporting species, from the largest whales to microscopic plankton.

programme.title: Nature's Hidden Miracles
programme.desc: Plants are communicating, helping each other thrive; staying aware of their surroundings by using dozens of highly sensitive sensors, plants are sending signals, even across species.

programme.title: Nature's Hidden Miracles
programme.desc: In order to adapt to different environments, protect themselves from enemies, obtain food, and reproduce, insects have become highly specialized; they transform themselves into completely different creatures, changing their habitat and even food.

programme.title: Nature's Hidden Miracles
programme.desc: Microorganisms are the rulers and guardians of Earth.

programme.title: Earth: The Nature of Our Planet
programme.desc: A miraculous mantle envelops the entire planet - a thin skin of gasses called 'air'. Without it, there would be no life or weather, no habitable conditions, or protection from lethal ultraviolet radiation or meteorites from outer space.

programme.title: Earth: The Nature of Our Planet
programme.desc: It's the solid crust of our planet, the perfect element in which to record the stories of deep time and of lifetimes. Change and progression is the way of earth. Air and water turn solid rock into soil.

programme.title: Car History

programme.desc: From small beginnings to world renowned company.

programme.title: Car History
programme.desc: Legendary racing successes, technological innovations and exclusive vehicles made Lancia world famous.

programme.title: Car History
programme.desc: The Motorsport division of BMW has been a success story since its inception, but they are not just celebrating success on the race tracks.

programme.title: Car History
programme.desc: A chronicle of Saab Automobile AB's glory and ruin, with an up-close look at its unique cars that enjoy immense popularity in a niche market to this date.

programme.title: Car History
programme.desc: Ford built one classic car after another and has always the same formula in mind: simple technique, pleasant design and affordable prices.

programme.title: Car History
programme.desc: The Swedish car company has been producing solid and safe vehicles since 1927.

programme.desc: The prototype of all off-road vehicles.

programme.title: Car History
programme.desc: No one is faster, no one is more reliable, and no one is more successful than Porsche Racing. With more than 28.000 victories in motorsports within 65 years, Porsche set a world record.

programme.title: Close Proximity
programme.desc: After a weeklong break, Matt and his crew are refreshed and ready for their next stop in Montreal.

programme.title: Close Proximity
programme.desc: After a controversial call by the judges at the Formula Drift stop in Montreal, Matt Field focuses on restoring his mangled car for the next stop.

programme.title: Close Proximity
programme.desc: Professional drift car driver Matt Field takes a break from the Formula Drift Championship Series and heads to Japan to compete in the D1 Grand Prix.

programme.title: Close Proximity
programme.desc: After returning from China, Matt Field heads to Fallon, Nevada to compete in the Fallon 250-a 250-mile off-road race alongside his father Bruce Field.

programme.title: Close Proximity
programme.desc: Professional drift car driver Matt Field prepares for the next Formula Drift stop at Texas Motorway.
